Others: Kawhi Leonard made his season debut for the Los Angeles Clippers in Saturday night's 131-105 victory over the Atlanta Hawks at the Intuit Dome.
Leonard scored 12 points and collected three rebounds in 19 minutes of play.
He brought the crowd to its feet during the first half after going 3-for-3 from long range.
He averaged 23.7 points, 6.1 rebounds and 3.6 assists in 68 games last season.
Leonard was limited to 52 games throughout the 2022-23 season and missed the 2021-22 season due to an ACL injury.
